issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task description) requires an addGuestStudents method with two parameters (int, String) — a number and a reason — but the solution implements addGuestStudents with only a single int parameter. The template also only contains a TODO for this method (no signature). This mismatch means students following the specification (or automated tests expecting the two-parameter signature) will be unable to match the solution's method signature or tests that expect addGuestStudents(int, String).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method signatures consistent. Either update the solution (and template) to implement the two-parameter signature declared in the problem statement: public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason) — and use or document the reason parameter — or change the problem statement/UML to specify a single-parameter addGuestStudents(int). Preferably update the solution and template to match the problem (two parameters) so students can implement the method as specified and tests expecting (int, String) will pass.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task description) specifies a method addGuestStudents(int, String) that accepts an int (number of new guest students) and a String (reason). The solution implementation declares addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) with only a single int parameter (no String reason). The template contains a TODO referring to the addGuestStudents method as specified in the task/UML. This mismatch in the method signature (missing second String parameter) breaks the one-to-one mapping between the requirement and the provided implementation, likely confusing students about the expected method signature and potentially causing test or compilation failures if students follow the problem specification.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution (and template) with the problem specification by changing the method signature to include the String reason parameter. For example: public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason) { this.numberOfGuestStudents += numberOfNewGuestStudents; /* optionally log or use reason */ } Ensure the template TODO and any tests expect the same signature.
